meanings.definition: The act of putting something in a bag.
meanings.sent1: After grocery shopping, the cashier started bagging my items.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoy bagging my lunch before heading to work.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved bagging a rabbit and making it disappear.
meanings.sent4: She was like a pro at bagging the groceries swiftly.
meanings.sent5: Bagging the fallen leaves made the yard look tidy and clean.

meanings.definition: The act of capturing or killing an animal, especially for sport.
meanings.sent1: During the hunting season, many people go bagging deer in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The trophy hunter boasted about bagging a rare species of bird.
meanings.sent3: The safari group succeeded in bagging a lion for their collection.
meanings.sent4: Bagging a big game requires patience and skill.
meanings.sent5: The documentary showed the dangers of bagging endangered animals for sport.

meanings.definition: The act of securing or achieving something.
meanings.sent1: His bagging of the top prize surprised everyone at the competition.
meanings.sent2: Bagging a promotion at work requires dedication and hard work.
meanings.sent3: She was on a winning streak, bagging victory after victory.
meanings.sent4: The team celebrated after bagging the championship title.
meanings.sent5: Bagging a record deal was a dream come true for the young musician.
